You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
NONPROFIT SUCCESS PACK (NPSP)
Salesforce Fundamentals for NPSP

Learn about the various ways to get help learning and using NPSP.

Get Started: Salesforce Fundamentals for Nonprofits
For nonprofits with limited resources, figuring out how to get started with the powerful Salesforce platform can feel overwhelming. But don't worry! We're here to help.
Fundamentals for Nonprofits
There are so many ways to learn about Salesforce. How you approach it depends on your learning style and preferences. Want to learn online on your own time? Try Trailhead. Want to read through detailed documentation, get one-on-one assistance, or talk to your peers? We've got you covered on all fronts! We have an amazing collection of resources below designed to help you get started & be successful with Salesforce.
Trailhead
Trailhead is the free, interactive and fun way to learn Salesforce. Learning paths called "trails" take you through the building blocks of the Salesforce platform. Start with these trails designed specifically to teach you how to use Nonprofit Success Pack at your nonprofit.
Documentation
The Knowledge base is a great place learn about the Nonprofit Success Pack and Salesforce. Learn about a few key articles to help deepen your understanding the NPSP product and how to use it.
Get One-on-One Assistance
Know who to reach out to for all your questions about Salesforce and Nonprofit Success Pack.
Talk to Your Peers
Sometimes the best way to learn is by talking to people who "get you." We highly recommend joining the Getting Started group in the Trailblazer Community. For people who are new to Salesforce, this is the best place to search for answers and ask questions.
Attend an Event
Keep an eye on the Customer Success calendar to stay in the loop on the latest events and webinars. You can filter by region and time zone and find events that work for you.
Get Official Salesforce Training
If you know that the only way you'll learn Salesforce is by sitting in a classroom and having a teacher check your work, don't worry -- we've got resources for you! There are a lot of training and certification options.
Get Started: Salesforce Fundamentals for Nonprofits

For nonprofits with limited resources, figuring out how to get started with the powerful Salesforce platform can feel overwhelming. But don't worry! We're here to help.

Fundamentals for Nonprofits

There are so many ways to learn about Salesforce. How you approach it depends on your learning style and preferences. Want to learn online on your own time? Try Trailhead. Want to read through detailed documentation, get one-on-one assistance, or talk to your peers? We've got you covered on all fronts! We have an amazing collection of resources below designed to help you get started & be successful with Salesforce.

Trailhead

Trailhead is the free, interactive and fun way to learn Salesforce. Learning paths called "trails" take you through the building blocks of the Salesforce platform. Start with these trails designed specifically to teach you how to use Nonprofit Success Pack at your nonprofit.

Trailhead: Explore Nonprofit Success Pack

Trailhead: Fundraise with Salesforce for Nonprofits

Trailhead: Manage Programs with Salesforce for Nonprofits

Trailhead: Engage Constituents with Salesforce for Nonprofits

Trailhead: Administer the Nonprofit Success Pack

Documentation

The Knowledge base is a great place learn about the Nonprofit Success Pack and Salesforce. Learn about a few key articles to help deepen your understanding the NPSP product and how to use it.

Nonprofit Success Pack Documentation

How the Import Process Works

Which Version of NPSP Am I Using?

If you're interested in other topics, use search to find more documentation.

Get One-on-One Assistance

Know who to reach out to for all your questions about Salesforce and Nonprofit Success Pack.

Account Executive If you have questions about your Salesforce product, or are interested in other Salesforce products, you can contact your Account Executive. Log into your org to find your Account Executive.

Consulting Partner If you know you need major implementation support, we highly recommend hiring a consulting partner. Most partners include training hours in their scope of work, in which they teach you how to manage your Salesforce org on your own. Check out the Salesforce.org website to Find a Certified Consulting Partner.

Ask an Expert This program lets customers ask a Salesforce employee product adoption, best-practice and how-to questions live. Find upcoming Ask An Expert sessions on the Customer Success Event Calendar.

Technical Support If you have a specific question about your Salesforce org, you can see How to Create a Case on Salesforce Help. Every Salesforce.org customer has access to a Standard Success Plan which includes access to Standard Support.

Premier Success If you would like more than just standard support, and want access to more 1:1 resources, you may be interested in purchasing a Premier Success plan. For more information about pricing for Premier Success, please reach out to us via the Contact Me form.

Pro Bono Salesforce.org's Pro Bono Program matches nonprofits with Salesforce professionals to help them with specific Salesforce challenges. Check out our website to Apply for Pro Bono Services.

Talk to Your Peers

Sometimes the best way to learn is by talking to people who "get you." We highly recommend joining the Getting Started group in the Trailblazer Community. For people who are new to Salesforce, this is the best place to search for answers and ask questions.

See Salesforce.org Get Started Hub.

Attend an Event

Keep an eye on the Customer Success calendar to stay in the loop on the latest events and webinars. You can filter by region and time zone and find events that work for you.

See Customer Success calendar.

Get Official Salesforce Training

If you know that the only way you'll learn Salesforce is by sitting in a classroom and having a teacher check your work, don't worry -- we've got resources for you! There are a lot of training and certification options.
